member.name: T:WSA.Foundation.Logger.AppCenter.AppCenter
member.summary: Entry point of the AppCenter component. This class provides methods to initialize this component.

member.name: T:WSA.Foundation.Logger.AppCenter.Internals.AppCenterTracker
member.summary: This class handles all Appcenter operations. Crashes and analytics would be logged in to AppCenter.

member.name: M:WSA.Foundation.Logger.AppCenter.Internals.AppCenterTracker.IsAnalyticsEnabled
member.summary: Is app center analytics logs are enabled.
member.returns: True if analytics is enabled else false.

member.name: M:WSA.Foundation.Logger.AppCenter.Internals.AppCenterTracker.IsCrashLogsEnabled
member.summary: Is app center crash logs are enabled.
member.returns: True if crash logs is enabled else false.

member.name: M:WSA.Foundation.Logger.AppCenter.Internals.AppCenterTracker.StartAppCenter(System.String)
member.summary: Initialize the app centers by passing key.

member.name: M:WSA.Foundation.Logger.AppCenter.Internals.AppCenterTracker.TrackEvents(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Tracking the event via app center events. Once you have started the SDK, use the TrackEvent() method to track your events with properties. You can send up to 200 distinct event names. Also, there is a maximum limit of 256 characters per event name and 64 characters per event property name and event property value.
member.returns: False if eventName or eventProperties are not following string length constraint else true.
